message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product, and I think it's worth a lot to you. I'm willing to start with a price of $12,000. What do you think?
Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate your enthusiasm, but $12,000 is a bit higher than I'm willing to go at this point.  I'm willing to pay $9,500 for the product.  Let me know what you think.

I understand you're looking to save some money, Bob. However, I've invested a lot in this product and I need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need $11,000 to make it worth my while. What do you think?

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $11,000 is still a bit more than I'm comfortable paying.  I'm willing to go up to $10,000.  This is a fair price considering the value of the product to me and the fact that you've already lowered your price.  Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

I understand you're trying to get the best deal, Bob, but I'm not willing to go any lower than $11,000. However, I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a one-year warranty and a premium support package. This is a one-time offer, and I think it's a great value. What do you think?
